definition: to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: The Senate adjourned for the summer.
Congress is in recess for the holiday season.
sentences.chinese: 国会在假期期间正休会中。

sentences.english: The Parliament was prorogued to the tenth of February.
They simply threatened to filibuster until the Senate adjourns.
sentences.chinese: 他们仅威胁说要发动抗争直到参议院休会。

sentences.english: Who handles the day-to-day work in between ministerial conferences?
sentences.chinese: 谁处理部长级会议休会期间的日常事务？

sentences.english: The chairman of the meeting announced a ten-minute recess.
sentences.chinese: 会议主席宣布休会10分钟。

sentences.english: And so, at six in the morning, a victorious Convention adjourns .
sentences.chinese: 这样，早上六点，胜利的国民议会休会了。

sentences.english: But then the Senate turned it down and adjourned.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这个法案被参议院否决了，随后进入休会期。

sentences.english: The chairman may adjourn the meeting at any time.
sentences.chinese: 主席任何时候都可宣布休会。

sentences.english: The house ought in conformity with ancient usage to adjourn over the easter holidays.
sentences.chinese: 依照传统习惯，议院在复活节期间应该休会。

sentences.english: Parliament be prorogue for the summer recess .
Mr Chairman, I move that the meeting be adjourned.
Postponement or adjournment to a future date.
sentences.chinese: 延期或休会至将来某一日期。

sentences.english: The meeting is adjourned since there is no quorum .
sentences.chinese: 因为没有法定人数会议休会。

definition: to hold a (business) meeting/to start negotiations
lower house of bicameral assembly/House of Representatives (USA)/Chamber of Deputies
abbr. for 參議院|参议院[can1 yi4 yuan4], senate/upper chamber (of legislative assembly)
lower chamber (of legislative body)/lower house/the House of Commons
